page.title: 01Central Bassenthwaite Area
page.content: This pleasant area within the Lake District National Park comprises the central part of of Bassenthwaite Lake and land to east and west. The main Keswick to Cockermouth and Workington Road the A66 traverses the western shore bordered by the woodlands of Thornthwaite Forest. Wythop Hall is the headquarters of the Forestry Commission for Thornthwaite. The roadside woodlands are deciduous with conifers planting on higehr ground. The eastern shore is bordered by good pasture land, grazed by sheep and beef cattle. The A591 Keswick to Carlisle road separates farmland from higher land which is partly afforested with conifers. The lake has associations with Alfred, Lord Tennyson, the poet. There are limited accommoation facilitis for visitors although there is a new development of holiday homes
